message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.HC, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses techniques for eliciting user preferences in recommender systems, which is a common topic in the fields of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The use of expected value of information (EVOI) is a Bayesian approach, which suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category. The paper also emphasizes the importance of making queries more cognitively manageable for users, which suggests a potential relevance to the human-computer interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the scalability of the proposed method for large item spaces, which suggests a potential relevance to the complex systems (cs.SI) sub-category.
